timeline.message: pluggable id strategies to make debugging and asserting about concurrent context propagation easier

timeline.bodyText:
Should we assert that only random is used if the writer is DDAgentWriter?
Perhaps we could even automatically set it to sequential if the ListWriter is used?
timeline.author: tylerbenson

replies.bodyText: I actually want the system property for benchmarking
replies.author: richardstartin

replies.bodyText: I'm not opposed to having that as an option.  I'm just saying it doesn't make sense to use non-random IDs for DDAgentWriter, so maybe we shouldn't allow it.  Are you using the agent writer for the benchmark?
replies.author: tylerbenson

replies.bodyText: Yes, sequential ids take up a lot less space because messagepack is good at stripping leading zeros. There is a WARN message in Config, stating if you don't use RANDOM, you're in uncharted territory and are alone. If you/anyone else would prefer that I remove the config option, I'll remove it.
replies.author: richardstartin

replies.bodyText:
another idea to consider is separating out the trace id and span id settings.  I think I'd be less concerned about spanid being sequential, but traceid has a much greater responsibility to be random in my mind.
(I would even suggest that sequential should be the default span id generator when using list writer.)
replies.author: tylerbenson

replies.bodyText:
OK, that makes sense. Since it's labour day on Monday and I want this for testing purposes (i.e. I have tests I want to write which depend on being able to do this), I will make changes along those lines next week but won't wait for approval.
If anyone wants the config property removed, please speak up, and I will remove it, but don't block the PR from being merged.
replies.author: richardstartin
